meanings.definition: An excessive or abnormally increased function
meanings.sent1: The hyperfunction of the machine caused it to overheat.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hyperfunction of the thyroid gland.
meanings.sent3: The hyperfunction of the coffee maker made it brew endless pots of coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperfunction in organizing events made her the go-to person for party planning.
meanings.sent5: The hyperfunction of the car engine made it roar like a lion.

meanings.definition: To perform a function excessively or abnormally
meanings.sent1: She tends to hyperfunction when under stress, trying to do too much at once.
meanings.sent2: The computer program started to hyperfunction, causing errors in the calculations.
meanings.sent3: The robot hyperfunctioned and kept cleaning the same spot repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: His brain seemed to hyperfunction, coming up with creative ideas non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The fan hyperfunctioned, spinning faster than usual and making a loud noise.
